sentences.english: Villagers are gathering at the entrance of the village to celebrate this year's grain harvest.
sentences.chinese: 村民们在村头集会，庆贺今年的粮食丰收。

sentences.english: I congratulate the Association on its successful arrangement of the General Congress.
sentences.chinese: 再一次庆贺大会的完竣召开。

sentences.english: This is the room(that /which)we’ll celebrate the New Year in.
sentences.chinese: 这是我们将要在里面庆贺新年的房间。

sentences.english: These plusses are well worth celebrating.
sentences.chinese: 这些plusses非常值得庆贺一番。

sentences.english: You can enjoy a lion dance on big celebration occasions.
sentences.chinese: 在盛大的庆贺场面上，你会看到狮子舞。

sentences.english: A lot of people converged on the town square to celebrate the victory.
sentences.chinese: 很多人聚集在镇广场上庆贺胜利。

sentences.english: The usual congratulatory crowd was conspicuously absent.
sentences.chinese: 平常的庆贺人群明显稀稀拉拉。

sentences.english: He and his wife Michelle bump fists in celebration in St. Paul, Minn.
sentences.chinese: 他和她妻子米歇尔在明尼苏达州圣保罗中心击拳庆贺。

sentences.english: Clouds in the home village work to son birthday celebration.
sentences.chinese: 云子在家中给中村功庆贺华诞。

sentences.english: We held a party to celebrate our success.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定举办宴会来庆贺这次演出成功。

sentences.english: The celebration of the Jade Emperor’s heavenly birthday has always signaled the winding-down of New Year festivity.
sentences.chinese: 庆贺玉帝诞辰的活动象征着过年的庆典接近尾声。

sentences.english: Players run onto court and hug Arbi, throwing him into air in celebration.
sentences.chinese: 球员们跑进球场拥抱阿尔比，将他抛向空中以示庆贺。

sentences.english: His elder daughter is getting married today; what a happy scene.
sentences.chinese: 他的大女儿今天结缡了，真是值得庆贺。

sentences.english: On the third day there was a wedding at Cana-in-Galilee.
sentences.chinese: 第三天，加利利的迦拿有一家人娶媳妇，设宴庆贺。

sentences.english: The church bells pealed out at the end of war to celebrate victory.
sentences.chinese: 战争结束时教堂钟声齐鸣以庆贺胜利。

sentences.english: And the fans of the home team had to accept it woefully with a heavy heart.
sentences.chinese: 主场球迷安静地看着进球队员的庆贺，内心非常发急。

definition: to congratulate respectfully/to express good wishes
congratulations on house-moving or promotion (idiom); Best wishes for your new home!
